2. declarativa—The termination of the acc. pl. is always *-os,² hence *inova *eqeb-as. We still find τόνς, ἐλευθέρονς, etc, in Orotan and Argiva inscriptions. Everywhcre else the phonetic changes already explained³ took place: Lesb. ἵπποις, Dor. Bceot. ἵππως, lora-Ate. ἵππους, Lat. equos. The type with a short vowel, τὸς θεός, etc, which is common in inscriptions and in the Dorio of Theocritus, comes from syntactical positions in which the v was dropped without any compensatory lengthen- ing, eg. τὸς θεὸς σέβομαι, but σέβομαι τὸς θεούς, and has thence been extended by analogy to other positione.
